Expand all combinations

Source: R/helpers.R
expand_combinations.Rd

Expands all possible pairs of integers (n*(n - 1)/2) (order doesn't matter) for 1:n. Useful for creating combinations of elements based on their indices in an array.

expand_combinations(n, self_pairs = FALSE)

Arguments

n

number of unique items
self_pairs

Should self-pairs be included? I.e. 2-2 and 4-4?

Value

dataframe with two columns a_index and b_index that contain all pairs.

Examples


# Default options dont have self-pairs
expand_combinations(4)
#> # A tibble: 6 x 2
#>   a_index b_index
#>     <int>   <int>
#> 1       1       2
#> 2       1       3
#> 3       1       4
#> 4       2       3
#> 5       2       4
#> 6       3       4

# Self pairs can be added, though!
expand_combinations(4, self_pairs = TRUE)
#> # A tibble: 10 x 2
#>    a_index b_index
#>      <int>   <int>
#>  1       1       1
#>  2       1       2
#>  3       1       3
#>  4       1       4
#>  5       2       2
#>  6       2       3
#>  7       2       4
#>  8       3       3
#>  9       3       4
#> 10       4       4
